section.title: Slide 1
section.related-content: The following video demonstrates TALONS service process to place a special order. Upon completion of this video you will have a basic understanding of how to create, inquire and deliver a special order to a work order.

section.title: Creating A Special Order
section.related-content: In this demonstration, we will create a special order for our loyal customer, Garth. Garth needs to replace his front fender after a minor accident. We need to special order the fender. The following demonstrates the steps for placing the special order as part of the work order.
the work order is created according to your normal dealership procedures.When adding parts if the part is not in stock you will be prompted to place a special order. Lets take a look at the process.
when we enter the part number and press tab bat
notice that the on hand quinity is zero so when we click OK
we are prompted with the option menu. to special order the part just click Create Special Order Button
you can see this part was added to the work order parts list with the S indicating it is a special order order item.
The part has now been placed on a Purchase Request that will be ordered by your parts department.

section.title: Inquiry About Special Order
section.related-content: After a couple of days have passed we would like to check if the special order part has come in so in TALON.
So we will search the browse customer screen for gaths costimer record

content.text: ‘E’ (Undelivered eCommerce Item) A green letter ‘E’ indicates there are undelivered eCommerce items for this customer. ‘P’ (Undelivered Prepaid Item) A green letter ‘P’ indicates there are undelivered prepaid items for this customer. ‘C’ (Committed) A green letter ‘C’ indicates a special order has already been fully committed to the customer. ‘C’ (Committed) A yellow letter ‘C’ indicates a special order item has been partially committed to the customer. ‘A’ (Available) A yellow letter ‘A’ indicates there is sufficient quantity on hand to fill this special order from stock. ‘N’ (Not Available) A red letter ‘N’ indicates there are no committed special orders for this customer and there is insufficient quantity on hand to fill the order from stock. ‘H’ (Prepaid Labor Hours) A yellow letter ‘H’ indicates there are available prepaid labor hours that have not yet been applied. ‘L’ (Layaways) - A blue letter ‘L’ indicates a layaway has already been committed to the customer.

section.related-content: The C in garths record indicates that the special order has been received and is committed
The C in garths record indicates that the special order has been received and is committed
we could also see more detail by clicking So/Layaway/ Prepaid

content.text: NOTE: Any Special Order Orginating from a Work Order can ONLY be Delivered to a Work Order and CANNOT be Delivered Over the Counter

section.related-content: From here we can see, when the order was placed , the vendor used or if there is any on hand quantity. The yellow triangle is an indicator that there is a message above. For service special orders you will see the work order _ Note any special order originating from a work order can only be delivered to a work order and can not be delivered over the counter.

section.title: Deliver Special Order
section.related-content: Now that we know the fender has arrived we can install it on the bike.
Once the special order has been received the technician is ready to install the fender. we need to deliver the special order to the work order. to complete this from the parts list
its important to note that we need to *deliver* the special order to the work order. to accomplish this click ADD
select the event
and click the Deliver special order button
tag the item
and then click deliver selected items

You can see the Special order indicator has changed from an S to a D on the Parts on work order screen. which indicates the part has been delivered Now the part has been delivered to the work order and the work order can be complete as normal. Note that the only time it is acceptable to leave the special order indicator as an S is when the part has not yet been received at the dealership and will be delivered at a later date.
